import React from 'react'; export const AmazingWorldOfVi = () => { let imgUrl = require('../../../assets/images/amazingWorldOfVim.png'); return (

Welcome

to

Why Vi/m?

Vi or Vim (Vi imporved) is a text editor that can be found almost on every unix/linux based machine.

If you connect to a dishwasher you can be almost certain that Vi or Vim will be available on that machine.

Therfor it is of GREAT importance to know how to use this mythical and mysterious text editor

First things first.

To open Vi or Vim simply type vi end hit the return button and Vi or Vim will be in action.

To open a file for editing with Vi or Vim simply type vi followed_by_your_filename.

Don't worry if the file does not exist Vi or Vim will kindly create it for you.

Second things first???

To open Vi or Vim is of course a heavenly feeling, but however

one needs to know how to quit Vi or Vim otherwise one will be stuck in Vi or Vim heaven for ever.

To quit Vi or Vim when opened in your terminal simply do the following:

  1. 1. Hit the ESC button
  2. 2. Type the following :q!
  3. 3. Hit the RETURN button

And you will acsend from Vi or Vim heaven

however the acsention is without saving the file you are editing.

The rest of this section is a list of commands and good stuff to know related to the Vi or Vim editor.

) }
